dc.desc: Each time the target takes damage, it makes a new wisdom saving throw against the spell. If the saving throw succeeds, the spell ends.

On failure, the target can be affected by one of the following effects of your choice for the duration. [Asleep. The target falls unconscious. It wakes up if it takes any damage or if another creature uses its action to shake the sleeper awake.] [Panicked. The target is frightened of you. On each of its turns, the frightened creature must take the Dash action and move away from you by the safest and shortest available route, unless there is nowhere to move. If the target moves to a place at least 60 feet away from you where it can no longer see you, this effect ends.] [Sickened. The target has disadvantage on attack rolls and ability checks. At the end of each of its turns, it can make another wisdom saving throw. If it succeeds, the effect ends.]
On a failed save, the target is restrained as its flesh begins to harden.
After succeeding on three of these saving throws, the creature recovers from the disease, and the spell ends.
On fail, become cursed for the duration of the spell.
A creature restrained by the tentacles can use its action to make a Strength or Dexterity check (its choice) against your spell save DC. On a success, it frees itself.
Can choose to not drop the object
On failure, the creature is charmed by you for the duration.
On a failure, you take 6d6 psychic damage and are insane until you finish a long rest.
Creatures are affected even if they hold their breath or don't need to breathe.
The target always takes the damage. On a failed save, the creature's Intelligence and Charisma scores become 1.
On a failed save, a creature suffers an effect based on its current hit points.
On a failed save, echoes of the phantasmal monstrosity spawn a nightmare that lasts the duration of the target's sleep and prevents the target from gaining any benefit from that rest.
A creature killed by this spell becomes a frozen statue until it thaws.
The creature must succeed on a charisma saving throw or be sent back to its home plane (if it isn't there already)
On fail, A creature drop whatever it is holding and become frightened for the duration.
If the creature succeeds, it is immune to this spell if you cast it again
On a failed save, the creature becomes charmed for the duration.
On failure, the creature is also blinded for 1 minute.
If the creature tries to use teleportation or interplanar travel to do so, it must first succeed on a Charisma saving throw.

On a failure, your soul moves into the target's body, and the target's soul becomes trapped in the container. On a success, the target resists your efforts to possess it, and you can't attempt to possess it again for 24 hours.
A creature can make a dexterity saving throw to grab onto a fixed object it can reach, thus avoiding the fall.
On a failed save, the creature is blinded until your next turn. On a successful save, it isn't blinded by this spell.
On a failed save, a creature takes 2d6 thunder damage and becomes deafened for 5 minutes.
If the creature fails this save, it is transported to a random location on the plane of existence you specify. A creature so transported must find its own way back to your current plane of existence.
For each target, roll a d8 to determine which color ray affects it.
On failed save, the creature is slowed.
On a failed save, the creature spends its action that turn retching and reeling.
